oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the role of energy conservation in high-energy nuclear scattering
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Drescher, H.J.
Hladik, M.
Ostapchenko, S.
Pierog, T.
Werner, Klaus
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Laboratoire SUBATECH Nantes (SUBATECH) ; Mines Nantes (Mines Nantes) ; Institut Mines-Télécom - Institut Mines-Télécom - Université de Nantes (UN) - IN2P3 - Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Institute of Physics: Open Access Journals
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: New Journal of Physics, Institute of Physics: Open Access Journals, 2000, 2, pp.31. <10.1088/1367-2630/2/1/331>
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: [PHYS.HTHE] Physics [physics]/High Energy Physics - Theory [hep-th]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We argue that the most commonly used models for nuclear scattering at ultra-relativistic energies do not treat energy conservation in a consistent fashion. Demanding theoretical consistency as a minimal requirement for a realistic model, we provide a solution for the above-mentioned problem, the so-called 'parton-based Gribov-Regge theory'. In order to keep a clean picture, we do not consider secondary interactions. We provide a very transparent extrapolation of the physics of more elementary interactions towards nucleus-nucleus scattering, without considering any nuclear effects due to final state interactions. In this sense we consider our model a realistic and consistent approach to describe the initial stage of nuclear collisions.
